abstract.p: Correction of Oct 16 and Oct 17 articles about suit against eBay involving auction of forged sports memorabilia; judge dismissed suit in its current form, but let plaintiffs refile case with more specific arguments; did not back eBay's motion to dismiss suit itself

block.p: An article in Business Day on Monday and a related article yesterday about a lawsuit against eBay referred imprecisely to a preliminary ruling in the case. In that ruling, which was made last Wednesday, the judge granted eBay's request to dismiss the complaints in their current form. But she let the plaintiffs refile the case with more specific arguments, accusing eBay of neglecting to protect consumers from sales of forged sports memorabilia in its online auctions. The judge did not support eBay's motion to dismiss the case itself. On Monday, the plaintiffs responded by refiling.
